oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup Aired Performance - 1946-08-24 - KOMA - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part two of an aired performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on August 24, 1946 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Hiram Higsby (master of ceremonies, writer), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Lem Hawkins; Ann Bond; Hiram Higsby; Dick Reinhart; Mary Lou
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) Lem Hawkins tells a joke [incomplete] / (1:22) Lem Hawkins performs "[Unidentified banjo tune]" / (2:15) Hiram Higsby and Ann Bond tell a joke / (3:02) Ann Bond performs "Tomorrow Never Comes" / (4:51) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page tell a joke / (5:25) Hiram Higsby and Lem Hawkins perform "Going Down The Road Feeling Bad" / (6:48) Hiram Higsby and Dick Reinhart introduce the next song / (7:00) Dick Reinhart performs "Press Along To The Big Corral" / (8:50) Hiram Higsby introduces the next song / (9:05) Dick Reinhart performs "Leave It There" / (11:13) Hiram Higsby and Allan Page talk about American freedom / (12:18) Dick Reinhart, Mary Lou, Lem Hawkins, Ann Bond, and Hiram Higsby perform "Ida Red" / (13:57) Closing statements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Bond, Ann; Higsby, Hiram, 1909-1975; Reinhart, Dick;
